extends Object

      • createSequentialUuid

        public static UUID createSequentialUuid()
        Creates a sequential UUID.

      • toBytes

        public static byte[] toBytes(UUID uuid)
        Converts the given uuid into a byte array.
        Throws:
        UuidFormatException - If the given uuid is null.

      • fromBytes

        public static UUID fromBytes(byte[] bytes)
        Converts the given bytes into an UUID.
        Throws:
        UuidFormatException - If the given byte array is null or its length is not 16.

      • fromString

        public static UUID fromString(String string)
        Converts the given string into an UUID.
        Parameters:
        string - Unlike UUID.fromString(java.lang.String), dashes may be omitted.
        Throws:
        UuidFormatException - If the given string is null or isn't a valid UUID.

      • createVersion1Uuid

        @Deprecated
public static UUID createVersion1Uuid()
        Deprecated. Use the UUID library directy.
        Creates a time-based version 1 UUID.

        To use this method, it must be able to access a special UUID library. If you use Maven, you should add the following dependency:

        <dependency>
    <groupId>com.eaio.uuid</groupId>
    <artifactId>uuid</artifactId>
    <version>3.2</version>
</dependency>
